qas.question: What objects were not used by early farm societies in the Near East ?
What did the use of pottery help early Japanese societies develop?
What trend led to parts of the world developing their own local Neolithic cultures?
What objects were not used by early farm societies in Africa?
What did the use of pottery help early African societies develop?
What trend led to parts of the world developing their own African cultures?

plausible_answers.text: Early Japanese societies and other East Asian cultures

qas.question: Who used pottery before developing events?

plausible_answers.text: Africa, South Asia and Southeast Asia

qas.question: Where did independent domestication events lead to their own cultures?

context: Not all of these cultural elements characteristic of the Neolithic appeared everywhere in the same order: the earliest farming societies in the Near East did not use <a0_0><b3_0>pottery<b3_0/><a0_0/>. In other parts of the world, such as <b7_0>Africa, South Asia and Southeast Asia<b7_0/>, <a2_0><b5_0>independent domestication events<b5_0/><a2_0/> led to their own regionally distinctive Neolithic cultures that arose completely independent of those in Europe and Southwest Asia. <b6_0>Early Japanese societies and other East Asian cultures<b6_0/> used pottery before developing <a1_0><b4_0>agriculture<b4_0/><a1_0/>.
